properties.displayName: Newly created VNets will have certain subnets assigned a Route Table
properties.description: This policy applies a specific Route Table to subnets during VNet creation. This Policy will look for the existence of a keyword in a subnet name to apply the Policy. This policy must partner with the policy 'append-route-table-to-subnet-during-subnet-creation-based-on-naming-convention' in order to fully work. Additionally this policy is parameterized to be able to target all regions where a route table exists.

metadata.description: This determines the keyword in the subnet name that will be used to trigger the Policy

metadata.displayName: Route Table Resource Groups Naming Convention
metadata.description: This is to help locate the regions route table. This concats the flagged resources region with this value. In example, if you defined this param as '-example': eastus-example.
This is the name for your route table. This assumes the route tables in all regions have the same name.
Enable or disable the execution of the Policy.
